title: Ticket #2157: condor_config_val -config mixes stderr/stdout output
description:
Typical output from condor_config_val -config: 

Configuration source:
        /var/home/condor/condor_config
Local configuration sources:
        /unsup/condor/etc/condor_config.hosts
        /unsup/condor/etc/condor_config.global
        /unsup/condor/etc/hosts/puffin.local

The actual list of files is sent to stdout. The headers (ex. "Configuration source:") go to stderr.

Problem 1: No guarantee that they'll arrive in the right order on an interactive terminal (but in practice it's fine).

Problem 2: If you route the output through less or try to capture it in another program, by default the headers disappear.

Problem 3: It's not really an "error" and doesn't belong in stderr.

We should make it stdout, not stderr.

The code in question is in /src/condor_tools/config_val.cpp PrintConfigSources, line 716-729.

BUT... why is it this way? Is someone relying on this behavior, perhaps having a script capture stdout to find a list of filenames and ignoring stderr? This behavior dates back to pre-2007 and probably dates back to the initial work.
check_ins: 2011-May-12 16:00   Check-in [21859]: When calling "condor_config_val -config", merge stdout and stderr together. We're just dumping it for user review anyway and it's more useful in light of #2157 Testing change, no version history needed. ===GT=== #2156 (By Alan De Smet )
